translated: on a flower of Acasia sirissa. If one offers oblations with this, it will summon even the king's daughter.

original: de nas gzhan yang sbyor ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang sbyor ba 'di yin te /
translated: Then, another practice:

original: rang byung gi me tog gis bskus pa'i ras la bcom ldan 'das zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma /
analyzed: rang byung gi me tog gis bskus pa'i ras la bcom ldan 'das zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma /
translated: Draw the Blessed One with one face and two arms,

original: lcags kyu dang autpala'i zhags pa phyag na bsnams pa bris la /
analyzed: lcags kyu dang autpala'i zhags pa phyag na bsnams pa bris la /
translated: holding a hook and an utpala with a noose.

original: de'i mdun du lha rdzas bzang po 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa byas la bcom ldan 'das la bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mdun du lha rdzas bzang po 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa byas la bcom ldan 'das la bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: In front of her, make offerings with “This excellent divine…” and so forth, and recite the Blessed One’s mantra.

original: aom aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ki mi pa sing ham sva pa nam ka tha aa h'um phat /
analyzed: aom aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ki mi pa sing ham sva pa nam ka tha aa h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ oṃ tāre tuttāre ture amukimāṃ pasīnaṃ katha āh hūṃ phaṭ.

original: stong phrag lnga bzlas pas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhags pas ske nas bcings te /
analyzed: stong phrag lnga bzlas pas 'ong bar 'gyur ro // zhags pas ske nas bcings te /
translated: By reciting it five thousand times, she will come.🔽Bind her neck with the noose.

original: lcags kyus phug la rkang pa gnyis nas autpala yis bcings la /
analyzed: lcags kyus phug la rkang pa gnyis nas autpala yis bcings la /
translated: Pierce her with the hook and bind her feet with the utpala.

original: bsgrub bya kun tu bkug ste /
analyzed: bsgrub bya kun tu bkug ste /
translated: Summon the victim completely.

original: rkang pa'i 'og tu bsams la /
analyzed: rkang pa'i 'og tu bsams la /
translated: Imagine her under your feet.

original: bran mo'i gzugs kyis longs spyad par bya'o //🔽de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis lan bdun bsngags te /
analyzed: bran mo'i gzugs kyis longs spyad par bya'o // de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis lan bdun bsngags te /
translated: Enjoy her in the form of a servant.

original: bdag nyid kyi mig gnyis la byugs la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi mig gnyis la byugs la /
translated: Then, anoint your two eyes with the other preparation, blessed seven times with the Tārā mantra.

original: rgyal po'i rigs kyi nang du zhugs na rgyal po dang bcas pas bla mar byed do //
analyzed: rgyal po'i rigs kyi nang du zhugs na rgyal po dang bcas pas bla mar byed do //
translated: If one enters among the royal class, one will be honored by the king and his court.

original: dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be able to enthrall them.

original: de nas gzhan @281b yang skyong ba ni sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis brgya rtsa brgyad brjod do //
analyzed: de nas gzhan @281b yang skyong ba ni sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis brgya rtsa brgyad brjod do //
translated: Next, for protection, one should recite the Tārā dhāraṇī one hundred and eight times.

original: sbrul gyi rgyal po mgo gnyis pa'i mgo thal bar byas te /
analyzed: sbrul gyi rgyal po mgo gnyis pa'i mgo thal bar byas te /
translated: One should reduce the head of the two-headed snake to ashes.

original: ba dmar mo'i mar la aarka'i spra ba'i sdong bu byas te /
analyzed: ba dmar mo'i mar la aarka'i spra ba'i sdong bu byas te /
translated: One should make a wick from red cow’s butter and Arka plant fibers.

original: me sbyar la dud pa bsag par bya'o //
analyzed: me sbyar la dud pa bsag par bya'o //
translated: One should light the wick and collect the smoke.

original: dud pa de dang rdo rje nyi ma dang / rdo rje chos dang bsres shing mnyes la rta mchog gis bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: dud pa de dang rdo rje nyi ma dang / rdo rje chos dang bsres shing mnyes la rta mchog gis bdug par bya'o //
translated: One should mix that smoke with Vajrasūrya, Vajradharma, and Vajravarahi, and then inhale it.

original: de nas thal ba dang lhan cig tu mig la bskus nas gang rdo rje mig gis bltas pa de'i padma r'a ga 'dzag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas thal ba dang lhan cig tu mig la bskus nas gang rdo rje mig gis bltas pa de'i padma r'a ga 'dzag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, one should apply the ashes to one’s eyes together with the smoke. Whoever is looked at with the vajra eye will have their padmarāga flow.

original: gal te de ltar ma gyur na ni bdag nyid sgrol mas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nges par spong ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar ma gyur na ni bdag nyid sgrol mas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nges par spong ba yin no //
translated: If that does not happen, Tārā herself will certainly abandon the Blessed Buddha.

original: de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang lto ba'i srin bu la gzungs kyis lan bdun bzlas la rdo rje chos dang lhan cig tu byas la sag rtsi dang sbyar la sbyin no //
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang lto ba'i srin bu la gzungs kyis lan bdun bzlas la rdo rje chos dang lhan cig tu byas la sag rtsi dang sbyar la sbyin no //
translated: Then, for another rite, one should incant the worms in the belly seven times with the dhāraṇī, and mix them with red arsenic together with Vajradharma.

original: de longs spyad na cho ga mchog 'dis rang gi chung ma bzhin du gtong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de longs spyad na cho ga mchog 'dis rang gi chung ma bzhin du gtong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one consumes them, by this supreme rite one will not be given up like one’s own wife.

original: de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang so ma brjes pa'i bu chung gi lce blangs la sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis lan bdun bsngags la //
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang so ma brjes pa'i bu chung gi lce blangs la sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis lan bdun bsngags la //
translated: Then, for another rite, one should take the tongue of a newborn baby that has not yet been buried, and incant it seven times with Tārā’s dhāraṇī.

original: bhring+ga r'a dza dang gi wang gcig tu byas te dpral bar thig le byas la de gang la bstan pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bhring+ga r'a dza dang gi wang gcig tu byas te dpral bar thig le byas la de gang la bstan pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should make a bindu on the forehead with bhrṅgarāja and bovine bezoar mixed together, and whoever is shown it will become enthralled.

original: sbyor ba gzhan yang zhag chen pos rang gi lus la byugs te bsgom pa dang ldan pas sgrol ma'i gzungs khri tsho gcig bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan yang zhag chen pos rang gi lus la byugs te bsgom pa dang ldan pas sgrol ma'i gzungs khri tsho gcig bzlas par bya'o //
translated: For another rite, one should anoint one’s body with human fat, and recite Tārā’s dhāraṇī one hundred thousand times while maintaining the meditation.

original: bzlas pa'i mthar 'bras s'a lu'i zan gyis dril phyis byas la de gang la byin pa de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i mthar 'bras s'a lu'i zan gyis dril phyis byas la de gang la byin pa de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: At the end of the recitation, roll it in rice from the field and give it to whomever. They will be under one’s power for as long as one lives.

original: sbyor ba gzhan yang zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su sgrol ma'i gzungs bzlas shing sngon du bsnyen pa byas la de las byung ba'i spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug tu du nga gi phye mas dgang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan yang zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su sgrol ma'i gzungs bzlas shing sngon du bsnyen pa byas la de las byung ba'i spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug tu du nga gi phye mas dgang bar bya'o //
translated: Another method: at the time of a lunar eclipse, recite the Tārā dhāraṇī and do the preliminary practice. With the rice that comes from that, one should fill a bag of Avalokiteśvara.

original: de gang la byin pa de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gang la byin pa de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Give it to whomever, and they will follow for as long as one lives.

original: sbyor ba gzhan yang sgrol ma'i gzungs smyo byed kyi 'bras bu la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags te /
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan yang sgrol ma'i gzungs smyo byed kyi 'bras bu la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags te /
translated: Another method: Enchant the fruit of the madana plant one hundred and eight times with the Tārā dhāraṇī.

original: 'bras bu de dang rta mgrin dang lhan cig tu gang la byin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu de dang rta mgrin dang lhan cig tu gang la byin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Give it to whomever together with Hayagrīva, and they will be under one’s power.

original: sbyor ba gzhan ni aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ka sa bandha na mu kti ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan ni aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ka sa bandha na mu kti ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Another method: oṃ tāre tuttāre ture amukaṃ bandhanaṃ muktikaṃ kuru svāhā.

original: sngags 'dis aarka'i 'dab ma la bsgrub bya'i ming bar du bcug ste bris la srin bu ka ka ru'i khung bur sbas na bcings pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags 'dis aarka'i 'dab ma la bsgrub bya'i ming bar du bcug ste bris la srin bu ka ka ru'i khung bur sbas na bcings pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having written the name of the person to be liberated from bondage in the middle of the leaf of arka wood with this mantra, if it is hidden in the hole of a kakarupa insect, he will be liberated from bondage.

original: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The sādhana of Vajra-Tārā is complete.
